FuncDef:
The user-traffic-statistic command configures the statistics mode for user traffic when SQ scheduling is applied to DAA services. Traffic statistics of the specified FQs (Flow Queue) are then collected as user traffic statistics.
The undo user-traffic-statistic command restores the default configuration.
By default, if DAA service separation is disabled, traffic statistics of all the eight FQs are collected as user traffic statistics; if DAA service separation is enabled, traffic statistics of FQs of non-DAA services are collected as user traffic statistics.
CLIs: user-traffic-statistic { cs7 | cs6 | ef | af4 | af3 | af2 | af1 | be } * { inbound | outbound }
undo user-traffic-statistic [ cs7 | cs6 | ef | af4 | af3 | af2 | af1 | be ] * { inbound | outbound }

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After CAR is performed on a DAA service flow, packets in the DAA service flow are re-marked with different priorities and are scheduled into SQs. In SQ-based traffic statistics, however, DAA traffic and non-DAA traffic are not differentiated. To specify the FQs of which traffic statistics are collected as user traffic statistics, run the user-traffic-statistic command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
This command takes effect only when DAA services are scheduled into SQs. This command takes precedence over DAA service separation configurations.
